fuzzing_params.Constraints: 1 <= n == s.length <= 10^5, s consists only of '0' and '1'., 0 <= numOps <= n

problem_info.title: 3399. Smallest Substring With Identical Characters II
test_examples: Example 1: Input: s = "000001", numOps = 1 Output: 2 Explanation: By changing s[2] to '1', s becomes "001001". The longest substrings with identical characters are s[0..1] and s[3..4].
Example 2: Input: s = "0000", numOps = 2 Output: 1 Explanation: By changing s[0] and s[2] to '1', s becomes "1010".
